title: Home Care Assistance Cincinnati continues its unprecedented growth
text:
CINCINNATI, Feb. 27, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- Home Care Assistance Cincinnati, a leading provider of in-home care for seniors, today announces the addition of the following employees to better meet the home care needs in Greater Cincinnati:
Kim Garry – Executive Director
Maurie Renke – Employee Care Manager
Ashlie Fultz – Client Care Manager
Michelle Smith-White – Administrative Assistant
Tonia See – Business Development Manager
Amy Beiting – Brain Fitness Coach
Kathy Mitchell – Brain Fitness Coach
"Our team has never been stronger," said Steve Sudberry, Owner of Home Care Assistance Cincinnati. "This new group of employees has positioned Home Care Assistance to meet the increased demand for our unique home care services in Greater Cincinnati. They are joining us in a stage of incredible growth and measured success. We are thrilled to have each of these new members on board as they will help lead us into 2018 and beyond."
To learn more about what Home Care Assistance has to offer or to schedule a free in-home consultation, please visit www.HomeCareAssistanceCincinnati.com or call 513-891-2273 today. Home Care Assistance Cincinnati is located at 7712 Montgomery Rd. Cincinnati, OH 45236.
ABOUT HOME CARE ASSISTANCE CINCINNATI
Home Care Assistance Cincinnati is the leading provider of home care for seniors in Greater Cincinnati and Northern Kentucky. Our mission is to change the way the world ages. We provide older adults with quality care that enables them to live happier, healthier lives wherever they call home. Our services are distinguished by the caliber of our caregivers, the responsiveness of our staff and our expertise in daily care. We embrace a positive, balanced approach to aging centered on the evolving needs of older adults. Home Care Assistance proudly trains Caregivers in their proprietary Cognitive Therapeutics Method , a one-on-one activities-based program designed to keep aging minds sharp. Based on scientific research suggesting that mental stimulation is associated with slower cognitive decline, the program targets the five primary cognitive domains. The activities that Caregivers do with clients are fun and engaging. Not only do they keep clients mentally sharp, but improves their overall quality of life.
